summary: This document is a court subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Lockheed Martin, demanding the company appear and produce records of any transactions with Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and related entities. The subpoena is part of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Issued the subpoena to Lockheed Martin as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, demanding records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as a defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The subpoena seeks records of transactions with her.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as an individual with whom transaction records are sought, indicating his financial dealings are part of the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Both are named together as subjects for which financial transaction records are being subpoenaed from Lockheed Martin, indicating their linked financial activities are under investigation.
Strauss, as U.S. Attorney, is prosecuting Maxwell in the criminal case referenced in the subpoena.

events.title: Scheduled Court Appearance for Lockheed Martin
events.description: Lockheed Martin is commanded to appear before the U.S. District Court to testify and produce records related to transactions with Epstein, Maxwell, and related entities.

events.title: Subpoena Issued to Lockheed Martin
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issued a court subpoena to Lockheed Martin demanding financial records.

locations: Lockheed Martin Co., 6801 Rockledge Drive, Bethesda, MD 20817
U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906, New York, NY
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office subpoenaed Lockheed Martin for records of any transactions with Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and related corporate entities (Air Ghislaine Inc., Shititka Air Inc., Freedom Mr International Inc.).
The subpoena is directly related to the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).
The subpoena demands Lockheed Martin's appearance in court on November 29, 2021, indicating an active investigation into the financial networks of Epstein and Maxwell.
The document reveals the investigation was seeking evidence of financial dealings between a major defense contractor (Lockheed Martin/Sikorsky) and the Epstein-Maxwell network.
